topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Rebooting Instances

body.p: You can soft or hard reboot a running instance.
With a soft reboot, the operating system is signaled to restart, which allows for a graceful shutdown of all processes. A hard reboot is the equivalent of power cycling the server.

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances tab.

In the Instances table, for the instance you want to reboot, click Edit Instance then Soft Reboot Instance or Hard Reboot Instance.
In the confirmation screen, click Reboot Instance to reboot.
The progress of the reboot is displayed in the Task column on the Instances screen.
